etymology.description: semantic: 亻 (person) + phonetic: 固; simplified 个 is a graphic variant of 箇, half of 竹.
etymology.interpretation: 個 combines the person element with the sound of 固 to convey the idea of a single person or unit, which extends to its use as a general classifier. The modern simplified 个 comes from an older bamboo-based variant (箇), later standardized for its simple, easily written shape.
etymology.simplification: Adopted the long-used cursive/abbreviated variant 个 (half of 竹) in place of 亻+固 from 個/箇, dropping both semantic and phonetic parts to standardize a minimal form.

examples.chinese: 这个人很好(這個人很好)。
请给我一个苹果(請給我一個蘋果)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng gěi wǒ yí gè píngguǒ.

examples.chinese: 每个人都有自己的想法(每個人都有自己的想法)。
examples.pinyin: Měi gè rén dōu yǒu zìjǐ de xiǎngfǎ.
